connector.description: Perform operations on Hazelcast distributed map.

camel.source.endpoint.defaultOperation.name: camel.source.endpoint.defaultOperation
camel.source.endpoint.defaultOperation.description: To specify a default operation to use, if no operation header has been provided. One of: [put] [delete] [get] [update] [query] [getAll] [clear] [putIfAbsent] [allAll] [removeAll] [retainAll] [evict] [evictAll] [valueCount] [containsKey] [containsValue] [keySet] [removevalue] [increment] [decrement] [setvalue] [destroy] [compareAndSet] [getAndAdd] [add] [offer] [peek] [poll] [remainingCapacity] [drainTo] [removeIf] [take] [publish] [readOnceHeal] [readOnceTail] [capacity]

camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.name: camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstance
camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint.

camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceN.name: camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceName
camel.source.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceN.description: The hazelcast instance reference name which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.hazelcast-map.bridgeErro.name: camel.component.hazelcast-map.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.hazelcast-map.bridgeErro.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.hazelcast-map.basicPrope.name: camel.component.hazelcast-map.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.hazelcast-map.basicPrope.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastI.name: camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastInstance
camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastI.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastM.name: camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastMode
camel.component.hazelcast-map.hazelcastM.description: The hazelcast mode reference which kind of instance should be used. If you don't specify the mode, then the node mode will be the default.
